intro: Toiyabea eximia, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its low, sprawling growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant has small, narrow leaves that are adapted to reduce water loss in arid environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. Toiyabea eximia is an important plant for local pollinators and is considered a symbol of the desert ecosystem.
